Notes: Always available, except if application whitelistening is active. Commonly blocked.
Scripting language file. Can be used to execute malicious scripts.
Encoded version of .vbs. Makes it harder to read, but can be used for same malicious purposes as .vbs.
Allows mixing of scripting languages. Can execute malicious scripts.
Used to set properties for script execution. Can be used in conjunction with other scripts for execution.
Can execute scripts, similar to other Windows scripting files like .vbs or .js.
Allows for the creation of COM objects with scripts. Can be used to execute malicious scripts.
If run, this file could potentially launch dangerous applications it came with or pass dangerous options to programs included with Windows.
ClickOnce applications can execute code when deployed.
Used to install apps. Potentially harmful if sourced from untrusted locations.
A pointer to a ClickOnce application. Can cause the referenced application to be run.
Can be used to install potentially malicious Windows apps.
Bundle of APPX packages. Can install potentially malicious apps.
Can run embedded scripts or malicious payloads when opened.
Legacy help file format. Can potentially execute other files or code under specific circumstances.
Executes directly, potentially harmful if malicious.
For customizing appearance in Windows, but be wary of the source.
Can be used to automate troubleshooting steps, but can also be abused.
Used to mount applications on macOS. If malicious, it can introduce harmful software to the system.
Can execute code, especially if the gadget is malicious.
An HTML application. Unlike HTML applications run in browsers, .HTA files are run as trusted applications without sandboxing.
Non-executable by default. However, contents inside can be harmful once deployed/mounted.
Can run Java applications remotely. Ensure Java security settings are strict.
A JavaScript file. .JS files are normally used by webpages and are safe if run in Web browsers. However, Windows will run .JS files outside the browser with no sandboxing.
Encoded .js file. Can execute malicious scripts.
Contains script to be executed in web pages.
Web page archive format. Potential risk if it contains malicious scripts and is opened in a browser.
Web page archive format. Potential risk if it contains malicious scripts and is opened in a browser.
It's an application bundle on macOS. If malicious, it can introduce harmful software to the system.
Can be used to run code when invoked by an application. Potential for malicious use.
Contains definitions and information for software components, but doesn't execute code itself.
A program information file for MS-DOS programs. While .PIF files aren
